You said:

Pipeline

What are these pipelines?
ChatGPT said:

In the context of your updates, pipelines refer to multi-step workflows used to chain together AI model inference, preprocessing, postprocessing, and data routing operations—typically in a modular and reusable way.

In more detail:

These pipelines:

  • Define sequences of operations where each step represents a model call, a data transformation, or some logic (like filtering, scoring, etc.).

  • Allow complex AI applications to be built from reusable components rather than hardcoding logic in a monolith.

  • Are versioned and configurable, enabling safe iteration and deployment.

  • Can be executed via the platform, through the CLI, or programmatically via the API or SDKs.

Examples of pipeline use cases:

  • An image classification pipeline that:

    1. Takes an uploaded image,

    2. Applies preprocessing (resizing, normalization),

    3. Runs it through an image model,

    4. Then sends the output to a moderation filter.

  • A chatbot pipeline that:

    1. Receives user input,

    2. Uses a classification model to detect intent,

    3. Routes to the appropriate language model,

    4. Formats the response for UI delivery.

Your recent updates suggest that these pipelines are becoming:

  • More robust (with improved validation and step scoping),

  • More secure (with better RBAC handling),

  • Easier to manage (with CLI and multi-step versioning),

  • Safer to roll out (thanks to feature-flag-controlled RPCs).

Let me know if you want to include a visual example or a code snippet of how one might be defined or triggered.

Default Data Handling and User Control Clarifai is designed to provide you with a rich, interactive platform where you can access your inputs and view prediction history. To enable this, we securely store the data you send to the platform. However, you remain in complete control of its retention. Secure Storage by Default: When you send inputs (such as images, text, or video) to your application, the data and its resulting predictions are stored. This allows you to review, search, and manage your data directly within the Clarifai Portal. Your Data is Not Used for Training: We do not use your private data to train our models or any other models on the platform unless you explicitly choose to share your inputs and annotations with the "Community." Full Control Over Retention: You can configure data retention policies to meet your specific security and privacy needs. Default Data Handling and User Control

Clarifai is built to offer a powerful, interactive experience—letting you view your inputs and prediction history—while keeping you in full control of your data.

  • Secure Storage by Default: Inputs like images, text, or video, along with their predictions, are securely stored to enable easy access and management within the Clarifai Portal.
